TextBlock.Text: CURIOUSNOMAI: So, what exactly is our plan of escape? Do we try to fly out?

ANALYTICNOMAI: I fear that such a contemporary strategy may not work here, the <color=orange>Vessel</color> is registering very strange readings from the surrounding environment. It is possible that space does not function normally here.
SPOOKEDNOMAI: What are we to do then? The warp core is damaged, so we can not simply warp out the <color=orange>Vessel</color>.
CURIOUSNOMAI: ...Perhaps we still can. We have many smaller warp cores throughout the <color=orange>Vessel</color>, perhaps we can use a black hole core to escape.
ANALYTICNOMAI: I do not believe that such an endeavor would succeed. A warp requires both a black and white hole, and we have no core with which to establish a white hole.
CURIOUSNOMAI: I believe that it is still worth attempting, especially seeing as we currently do not have better ideas.
ANALYTICNOMAI: I will concede that it is currently the best idea we have.

NOMAILEADER: It is settled then, we will attempt to construct a makeshift warp device using one of the smaller black hole cores. I suggest that we do this in the lower bridge, as that area is both near the existing warp circuitry, and it should be easy to create a small area of artificial gravity down there so that we can work.
